name: Champagne Pierre Peters L'esprit Grand Cru
note: A vintage powerhouse to transform a snack into a celebration.
description: A sophisticated, structured vintage Champagne. Offers intense minerality, ripe orchard fruit, and a creamy, lingering autolytic depth.

name: Acham-Magin Riesling Trocken
note: Crisp acidity to cut through the salt and smoke.
description: Very dry and lean. It showcases electric acidity with classic notes of lime, wet stone, and a hint of petrol.

name: Rafael Palacios Godello
note: Spanish olives meet Spanish white; a perfect regional match.
description: Medium-bodied and dry. Balancing a waxy texture with bright acidity, it offers flavors of yellow plum and a distinct salty minerality.

name: Selbach-Oster Zeltinger Zonnenuhr Auslese
note: The slight sweetness plays beautifully against salty olives.
description: Lusciously sweet yet balanced by piercing acidity. Rich honeyed apricot and tropical fruit notes with a clean, flinty backbone.

name: E. Pira di Chiara Boschis Dolcetto Alba
note: A juicy, purple-fruited red that cuts through the rich fat of the Iberico ham.
description: Dry and medium-bodied with soft tannins. Dominated by black cherry and violet aromas with a refreshingly bitter almond finish.

name: Cavalotto Langhe Nebbiolo
note: The tannins and acidity are the perfect 'cleaner' for high-quality cured meats.
description: Dry with firm, grippy tannins and high acidity. Displays complex notes of dried rose, tar, and crunchy red berries.

name: Chateau Lanessan
note: The earthy complexity of aged Bordeaux highlights the nutty flavors of Bellota-grade ham.
description: Dry and well-structured with resolved tannins. Features savory cedar, tobacco leaf, and maturing blackcurrant flavors.

name: Acham-Magin Riesling Trocken
note: Bright acidity to balance the gooey cheese and sweet vanilla compote.
description: A laser-focused dry white. High acidity provides a palate-cleansing effect against rich fats, featuring green apple and citrus zest.

name: Domaine E. Guigal Côtes du Rhone Blanc
note: The floral Viognier notes mirror the aromatic vanilla in the compote.
description: Dry and medium-plus body. Highly aromatic with notes of apricot, white peach, and honeysuckle, offering a smooth, oily texture.

name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
note: A rich, textured white that stands up to the weight of baked cheese.
description: Dry and full-bodied. A masterclass in balance, showing ripe pear, lemon curd, and a subtle, integrated oak spice.

name: Champagne Pierre Peters
note: Classic saline pairing for fresh shellfish.
description: Brut and crystalline. Characterized by high tension, sea-spray salinity, and a sharp lime-driven finish.

name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
note: Chardonnay with enough citrus 'zing' for the dill and horseradish.
description: A vibrant, dry white with excellent concentration. Bright citrus acidity is layered over a rich, limestone-driven mineral core.

name: Champagne Pierre Peters MAGNUM
note: The finest bubbles for the finest start to your meal.
description: Enhanced depth from magnum aging. Exceptional finesse with persistent bubbles, green apple, and a long, chalky mineral tail.

name: Jean Collet Cremant de Bourgogne
note: Creamy bubbles to match the Røros cream.
description: Dry and festive. Features a creamy mouthfeel with notes of golden apple and freshly baked sourdough.

name: Champagne Pierre Peters
note: Blanc de Blancs highlights the delicate salinity of Løyrom.
description: Pure and focused. The high acidity and saline notes act as a perfect foil to the richness of the Røros cream.

name: Chavy Chouet Aligoté
note: Zesty acidity cuts through the fried richness and cheese.
description: Bone-dry and lean. Known for its high-toned acidity and zesty lemon-peel flavors, perfect for cutting through fried textures.

name: Cavalotto Langhe Nebbiolo
note: Tannins to balance the fat and salt of the Bellota ham.
description: Dry with structured tannins. Shows bright red currant and sour cherry flavors with earthy undertones and a long finish.

name: Chateau Ducru Beaucaillou, Le Petit Ducru
note: A structured red that honors the intensity of aged Ibérico ham.
description: Dry, full-bodied, and polished. Lush black fruit is framed by fine-grained tannins and elegant cedar spice.

name: Glantenay Bourgogne Côte d'Or
note: Delicate red fruit that won't overwhelm the raw beef.
description: Dry and light-to-medium bodied. Silky tannins accompany flavors of wild strawberry, raspberry, and a soft forest-floor earthiness.

name: Cavalotto Langhe Nebbiolo
note: Nebbiolo structure handles the salty Västerbotten cheese well.
description: A dry, high-acid red. Its tannin profile stands up to the protein of the beef, while offering complex floral and spicy aromatics.

name: Cyprien Arlaud Vosne-Romanée
note: A floral, silky Pinot Noir for the ultimate tartare experience.
description: Dry, elegant, and ethereal. Boasts velvet tannins, deep red cherry fruit, and an exotic spice profile characteristic of Vosne.

name: Domaine E. Guigal Côtes du Rhone Blanc
note: The Viognier in the blend tames the spice of the feta.
description: Medium-bodied with a round texture. Its floral apricot and peach flavors balance the heat of the spicy feta beautifully.

name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
note: Round and buttery, matching the sauce's texture.
description: Dry and texturally rich. Provides a creamy palate of yellow apple and lemon cream with a light mineral finish.

name: Chavy-Chouet Meursault
note: The golden standard for scallops in cream sauce.
description: Full-bodied and indulgent. Expect classic Meursault notes of hazelnut, buttered toast, and ripe stone fruit with balanced acidity.

name: De Montille Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru
description: Dry and monumental. Intense concentration of citrus, crushed stones, and white pepper with immense aging potential and length.

name: Domaine E. Guigal CdR Blanc
note: Aromatic and round to balance the chili and shellfish.
description: Soft and dry with low-to-medium acidity. Floral notes and honeyed stone fruits provide a soothing counterpoint to the chili heat.

name: Francois Carillon Puligny-Montrachet
note: Clean, linear acidity for the lemon and rich langoustine.
description: Precise and dry. Features high-definition notes of lemon zest and white peach, with a signature flinty, linear finish.

name: Domaine Bonneau du Martray Corton-Charlemagne
note: A legendary white for a standout seafood pasta.
description: Regal and complex. A full-bodied white showing extraordinary depth of fruit, precise mineral tension, and a regal, spicy finish.

name: Château Camino Salva
note: Rustic Bordeaux that loves braised meat and cheese.
description: Dry and medium-bodied. Offers classic dark fruit flavors with earthy, savory undertones and grippy tannins for the ragu.

name: Chateau Lanessan
note: Aged Bordeaux with softened tannins for the ragu.
description: Dry and elegant. The secondary notes of leather and forest floor are emerging, complementing the slow-cooked beef cheek.

name: Chateau Ducru Beaucaillou
note: Rare vintage excellence for a classic comfort dish.
description: Dry, full-bodied, and profound. Exceptional structure with fully integrated tannins and a deep, complex bouquet of cassis and truffle.

name: Reynaud Crozes-Hermitage Beaumont
note: Peppery Syrah is the classic match for gamey duck and bitter artichoke.
description: Dry and medium-plus body. Characterized by savory notes of black pepper, smoked meat, and dark bramble fruit.

name: Cavalotto Langhe Nebbiolo
note: The high tannins cut through the salt of the aged Pecorino and the richness of the duck.
description: Firm and dry. High tannin and acid provide the structural 'clout' needed to balance the intensity of the 36-month Pecorino.

name: Cyprien Arlaud Vosne-Romanée
note: An elegant, earthy red to mirror the complexity of orange zest and artichoke.
description: Supple and dry. Its aromatic complexity of red berries and dried herbs matches the citrus and artichoke elements of the dish.

name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
note: Buttery Chardonnay for the plum and butter base.
description: Dry and texturally generous. Provides enough weight to match the butter sauce while maintaining fresh acidity.

name: Chavy-Chouet Meursault
note: Classic Meursault richness for a heavy white fish.
description: Full-bodied with a nutty, buttery profile. The ripe fruit and oak integration complement the oily, rich nature of the halibut.

name: Domaine Leflaive Puligny-Montrachet
note: Unmatched purity and precision to highlight the Halibut.
description: Dry and incredibly elegant. Offers crystalline purity, white blossom aromas, and a finish of immense focus and length.

name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
note: A noble fish requires a noble white; the weight matches the shellfish sauce.
description: A dry, high-quality white with a silky mouthfeel and clean citrus acidity to lift the shellfish sauce.

name: Chavy-Chouet Meursault Cassé Tete
note: Intense minerality and butter notes to complement the grilled turbot.
description: Full-bodied and structured. The smoky minerality from the soil echoes the char of the grilled fish perfectly.

name: Domaine de Montille Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru
note: A legendary Grand Cru pairing for the most premium seafood on the menu.
description: Dry and powerful. A wine of great density and breadth, with layers of orchard fruit, spice, and crushed rock.

name: Reynaud Crozes-Hermitage Beaumont
note: Peppery Syrah for the herb-heavy sauce.
description: Dry and medium-plus body. Bold black pepper and olive notes harmonize with the herbaceous Café de Paris butter.

name: Chateau Lanessan
note: Earthy, structured Cabernet blend for the ribeye fat.
description: Dry and firm. Its tannic structure and dark fruit depth provide the necessary backbone for the rich entrecôte fat.

name: Prosecco ITA DOC Spumante Brut, Veneto
Antinori Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio DOC, Toscana

Hugel Gentil Alsace
note: Aromatic white to balance the savory broth.

name: Louis Jadot Beaujolais-Villages
note: Fruity and light, a classic bistro pairing.

name: Domaine Weinbach Riesling Schlossberg
note: Grand Cru Alsace power for a rich soup.

name: Prosecco ITA DOC Spumante Brut, Veneto
Antinori Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio DOC, Toscana
Petit Chablis
note: Crisp acidity cuts through the garlic butter.

name: William Fevre Chablis
note: Mineral and precise, the perfect snail companion.

name: Ravenau Chablis 1er Cru Montée de Tonnerre
note: A legendary Chablis for a classic dish.

name: Prosecco ITA DOC Spumante Brut, Veneto
Antinori Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio DOC, Toscana
Prosecco ITA DOC Spumante Brut, Veneto
Antinori Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio DOC, Toscana
Muscadet Sèvre et Maine sur Lie
note: Saline and fresh, made for shellfish.

name: Sancerre Domaine Vacheron
note: Elegant herbal notes complement the mussels.

name: Didier Dagueneau Silex
note: The ultimate expression of Sauvignon Blanc.

name: Prosecco ITA DOC Spumante Brut, Veneto
Prosecco ITA DOC Spumante Brut, Veneto
Chateau Ducru Beaucaillou
note: An aged powerhouse with soft tannins and immense depth for a shared steak experience.
description: A masterpiece of dry, mature Bordeaux. Extraordinary depth, silky tannins, and complex notes of graphite, cedar, and dried fruit.

name: Glantenay Bourgogne Côte d'Or
note: Soft Pinot Noir to cut through the foie gras.
description: Dry and graceful. Its vibrant red acidity helps refresh the palate between rich bites of tenderloin and foie gras.

name: Le Petit Ducru Beaucaillou
note: A structured Saint-Julien to handle the truffle and fat.
description: Full-bodied and dry. Polished tannins and concentrated dark fruit offer the luxury required for this classic French dish.

name: Clos de La Roche Grand Cru
note: Opulent, intense, and a perfect match for truffle.
description: Dry, rich, and gamey. A powerful Grand Cru showing profound earthy complexity and a massive, silk-laden finish.

name: Antinori Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio DOC, Toscana
Côtes du Rhône Rouge
note: Spicy and robust enough for the beef.

name: Prosecco ITA DOC Spumante Brut, Veneto

Château Rieussec Carmes de Rieussec
note: Honeyed sweetness to match the custard.

name: Château d'Yquem
note: The king of wines for the queen of desserts.

Antinori Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio DOC, Toscana
Antinori Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio DOC, Toscana
Jean Collet Cremant de Bourgogne
note: Bubbles and bread—the ultimate texture match.
description: Dry and energetic with a fine mousse; features sharp green apple notes and a refreshing citrus finish.

name: Champagne Pierre Peters Blanc de Blancs
note: Elevates the simple bread with toasted brioche notes.
description: Bone-dry and chalky with high acidity. Expect elegant layers of lemon zest, white flowers, and a toasted almond finish.

name: Chavy-Chouet Meursault Cassé Tete
note: Rich enough to handle the cream and luxurious enough for caviar.
description: Dry and opulent. Exhibits a beautiful tension between toasted hazelnut richness and a piercing, stony mineral finish.

name: Acham-Magin Riesling
note: Riesling is the king of pairing with cabbage and yuzu acidity.
description: Zesty and dry. The high acidity mirrors the yuzu, while the fruit profile complements the sweetness of the apple compote.

name: Francois Carillon Chassagne Montrachet 1er Cru
note: A complex white that mirrors the multi-layered flavors of this salad.
description: Full-bodied and dry. Displays intense power, toasted nut notes, and a persistent citrus acidity that frames the rich fruit.

name: Cyprien Arlaud Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru
note: A muscular red for the most serious of steaks.
description: Dry and powerful for Pinot Noir. A Grand Cru with exceptional concentration, depth of red fruit, and refined but present tannins.

name: Château Camino Salva
note: A classic Haut-Médoc to stand up to the bold pepper and butter sauces.
description: Dry, tannic, and dark. The classic blackcurrant and cedar profile is a robust match for the peppery sauce.

name: Reynaud Crozes-Hermitage Beaumont
note: The spicy, black-pepper profile of Syrah is the natural partner for steak au poivre.
description: Vibrant and dry. Features smoky aromatics and spicy black fruit that thrives alongside peppercorn-based sauces.
